review: I bought the Amazon Fire TV for $99 and after about 6 months I was very disappointed with the quality of the Fire device which I received.  On top of the fire tv device, I  ordered a Kindle before and wasn’t incredibly happy with both devices.  My Kindle froze many times and I had to exchange it for another one.  The same thing happened with my Amazon fire device when my remote stopped working and I had to order another one.  Be very careful when ordering hardware devices from AmazonAfter ordering the Fire TV device and having to replace the remote control, I’m very hesitant on ordering any hardware devices from Amazon.  It doesn’t surprise me that Amazon is now charging $39 for the same device which I paid $99 for due to the fact that obviously their product quality is either deteriorating or has been below mediocre since they started trying to sell hardware products.  Due to all of these problems with their hardware devices, I never ordered the fire phone which Amazon came out with a few months ago, and I haven’t heard about since then, probably due to the fact that Amazon’s hardware devices’ are way behind in terms of quality compared to their competitors like Google and Apple.I haven’t seen an advertisement for the Fire phone since about June 2014 and it is now almost January 2015 which means that Amazon not only has been lowering prices on it’s already existing hardware devices, but hasn’t even continued to advertise it’s “up and coming new” hardware devices.  Instead, it seems like, Amazon has taken a “backwards” approach and decided to lower it’s prices on it’s already existing hardware devices such as Amazon fire stick, and fire tv devices, and discontinued it’s sales of devices such as the fire phone.The main point of this entire blog is that if you are a company which stands behind it’s services and continues to deliver great services and tries to compete with other companies to deliver great products, than deliver great PRODUCTS.  Don’t think that because you have a good market for your services, that your products will automatically be bought by the same market.  For example, I think that Amazon’s services are still somewhat okay, but I think their products are below mediocre.
